TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract serializable beforefieldinit RequestException extends System.Exception
Public MustInherit Class RequestException Inherits Exception
public ref class RequestException abstract : Exception

Docs.summary: The base class for exceptions thrown on request failures.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message*> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error. This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for the new instance.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message>|The localized error message string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message> property of the new exception using the `message` parameter. The content of `message` is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for the new instance.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message>|The error message string.|

Docs.param: A object that holds the serialized object data.
A object that contains the contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed
Protected Sub New (message As String, innerException As Exception)

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for the new instance.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException>|The inner exception reference.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message>|The error message string.|
